completionStatement: Kick, Hi-Hats, and voice choking implemented
features: Kick pitch envelope: exponential sweep from 2× to 1× base frequency
Kick attack transient: noise burst scaled by tone parameter
Hi-hat bandpass filtering: 6-12 kHz range controlled by tone parameter
Voice choking: Closed hat (note 42) immediately stops open hat
Individual outputs: Kick (bus 1), Closed Hat (bus 5), Open Hat (bus 6)
notes: Kick uses exponential pitch envelope updated per-sample for smooth frequency sweep
Kick attack transient uses juce::Random (NOT rand()) for real-time safety
Hi-hat voices share same architecture (6 oscillators + filter) with different decay times
Voice choking implemented: Closed hat stops open hat BEFORE triggering (deterministic order)
All components prepared in prepareToPlay() - no allocations in processBlock()
Individual output routing verified: channels 2-3 (Kick), 10-11 (Closed Hat), 12-13 (Open Hat)
